[quote name='The_Mad_Emu'][url]http://imgur.com/a/IIktI[/url]

THe LSSF or light space strike fighter is one of our best space fighters it is large enough to fight by itself but small enough to be a large carrier fighter its is armed with 6 emus beak guided torpedos it has a power plant of 6 ion engines with plenty of xeon it also has large amount solar panals so it will never run out of power

[URL]https://www.dropbox.com/s/3bmtkafulpil5tf/the%20emu%20lssf.craft?dl=0[/URL][/QUOTE]

Sorry, I've just been trying to be as constructive as possible with my advice yet Emu keeps PM-ing me over and over and I'm just getting tired of it.

[SPOILER= Bolt]
[imgur]yL3OH[/imgur][sketchfab]e8ca83f604ad4a5d934f43b4403ea082[/sketchfab]
[url=https://sketchfab.com/models/e8ca83f604ad4a5d934f43b4403ea082]Bolt[/url] by [url=https://sketchfab.com/georgegouyer]georgegouyer[/url] on [url=https://sketchfab.com]Sketchfab[/url]
Introducing the Bolt its not fast or maneuverable but it packs a punch. equipped with 10 mavericks it should be more then capable of dealing with a wide variety of threats from groups of infantry to enemy bases.
Action groups are as follows
1: Toggles the Bomb bay.
2: Fires the selected weapon
3: Next weapon
4: Previous Weapon
[url]https://www.dropbox.com/s/qrcauw7coq16atq/Bolt%20B.craft?dl=0[/url]
[/SPOILER]
[SPOILER= Sabertooth]
[CENTER][FONT=Times New Roman][SIZE=7][COLOR="#A52A2A"]Introducing the Sabertooth[/COLOR].[/SIZE][/FONT][/CENTER]
[imgur]NqIGA[/imgur][sketchfab]50d00c6f74714b6ba1246abe301648f1[/sketchfab]
Named after the Big cat of prehistoric times it is Capable of filling multiple roles From Antitank to Anti Air. The Sabertooth comes equipped with the Direwolf modular weapon system allowing it to switch out weapons systems depending on the situation. From laser to cruise missiles and everything in between you should find them useful in engaging multiple threats. The frame itself comes equipped with a radar receiver allowing you to use radar guided missiles without making yourself a target. Overall this makes the wolf obsolete in nearly all regard.

Action groups:
1 Fires the selected weapon
2 Selects the next weapon
3 Selects the previous weapon
Download Weapon modules here.
[url]https://www.dropbox.com/s/5u0a26rbhwi1joj/Direwolf%20weapon%20system.rar?dl=0[/url]
Download the actual Sabertooth chassis here.
[url]https://www.dropbox.com/s/uzqb5nsop9gawfh/Sabertooth.craft?dl=0[/url]
[/SPOILER]
[SPOILER= Panther]
[FONT=Times New Roman][SIZE=7][COLOR="#A52A2A"]Introducing the Panther[/COLOR].[/SIZE][/FONT]
[imgur]OrTXn[/imgur]
The best tank i have ever built that looks nice this tank has been days in the making. Equipped with 1 30mm chain-gun for A2A and destruction of light ground vehicles however this nothing compared to the 2 howitzers it uses to engage heavy vehicles from any range. No matter if you are 4 km or 500m this tank will kill you if you let it.



Action groups:
1 Fires the selected weapon
2 Selects the next weapon

Download here
[url]https://www.dropbox.com/s/h5pxv6xtevr70z7/Panther.craft?dl=0[/url]
[/SPOILER]

[quote name='Spearka']Sorry, I've just been trying to be as constructive as possible with my advice yet Emu keeps PM-ing me over and over and I'm just getting tired of it.

That and the thread is becoming little but more Emu craft being announced and I'd like some more diversity[/QUOTE]

I can't say anything about the PM's, but I literally just read through a good bit of this thread, and in the past month, many people have posted more craft than Emu.

And I am not responding to constructive critisism, I responding to stuff like
[quote name='Spearka']TBH it's not even anti-fighter. I'm sure that a Thalia could tank infinite amounts of those missiles.

I mean, if you don't believe me see Ep. 23 with the Trishulas missiles, they had similar structure and couldn't even get through a Longswords weak armour[/QUOTE]

and

[quote name='Spearka']emu stahp[/QUOTE]

and

[quote name='Spearka']

Emu, we need to talk about your making of too many ships[/QUOTE]

Constructive critisim involves informing a person on what they did wrong, so they can fix it, not just stating something is bad/wrong. I also found the bottom two quotes rude, as they basically discourage a player from playing the game and submitting craft.(The entire point of this thread) I do not understand how you see this as only Emu announcing craft, because put up far less craft than others in this thread. Also, it just isn't your place to tell him to stop. He never reached a spam level of posting, so he shouldn't be treated as if he had.

-JT

I'm going to get HatBat to resolve this issue so the thread can move on to making spaceships.:D

I've contacted Emu and asked him to organise his craft better. Please no more mention of this, we have a much bigger problem on the horizon. Which brings me to my announcement: in it's current state this thread wouldn't be acceptable on the new forum, so I've got some severe reforms planned that Kasper confirmed for me would make this thread acceptable.

ScriptKitt3h will hopefully give you all more information when he's available.

Thanks for the notification HatBat

I'd also like to add that I would advise everyone to back up all your Rocket Builders threads as the entire section will be going when the new forum comes up.

hi guys just uploaded a new craft the emu hunter hb edition you can view it here [URL]http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/140145-MOD-STOCK-EMU-DYNAMICS-WARFARE-CRAFT-%28some-include-bd-amourey%29[/URL] hey guys just started vote for what i will build next would you be so kind to take part in it Edited November 23, 2015 by The_Mad_Emu

Sorry to bring the subject back in but I am afraid I have to compile this together.

First, I have to apologise to all of you guys, especially The_Mad_Emu. I have been in a very tired state these past few weeks mainly due to IRL studies and events and I haven't been making anything new since the Melek and Nixilis aircraft a while ago. This tiredness has not been helped one bit from the barrage of PMs from Emu


I have tried my best to be constructive all this time but I am now worn out which explains what happened here

[quote name='JTpopcorn']
Constructive critisim involves informing a person on what they did wrong, so they can fix it, not just stating something is bad/wrong. I also found the bottom two quotes rude, as they basically discourage a player from playing the game and submitting craft.(The entire point of this thread) I do not understand how you see this as only Emu announcing craft, because put up far less craft than others in this thread. Also, it just isn't your place to tell him to stop. He never reached a spam level of posting, so he shouldn't be treated as if he had.

-JT

I still completely accept the blame, I have completely failed myself by abandoning what I can only interpret as my only fan ever, reflecting on this I do not even believe myself to even be worthy of this lovely community; I like to roleplay and because of events that conspired long, long ago it is forbidden, making me an obselete user; scorned upon by moderators, I even hold myself responsible for the shutdown of Rocket Builders since there is no bigger roleplayer than myself (I think).

Which brings me onto my next point, since I don't hold myself worthy I would like to announce two things: First is that I am rescinding my submissions; I have been rude and neglecting and such people do not deserve to feature in the Kethane Station series; second is that I am going on a temporary leave, I don't know how long I will be gone, maybe a day, a week, maybe even another 2 years but I need to get my strength back. You people are an amazing community that flourished without me and I'm sure you'll continue amazingly with my absence again. I do not want your sympathy or compensation, I just want to know you looked at this post and acknowledged its existence; I don't want to be an attention ..... and sorry again if I have been so, I wish you all the best of luck, especially you HatBat with the production of new Kethane Station Episodes, I have faith at least that you'll do everyone proud

--Spearka

Edited November 29, 2015 by Spearka
Yeah, no more submissions from me until the new forums. I'm not sure what will happen...hehe

[COLOR=#333333]hi guys just uploaded a new craft the emu h bumber (big/heavy bomber) you can view it here [/COLOR][URL="http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/140145-MOD-STOCK-EMU-DYNAMICS-WARFARE-CRAFT-%28some-include-bd-amourey%29"]http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/...-bd-amourey%29[/URL] you can find it at the bottom of the air section p.s [COLOR=#333333]hey guys just started vote for what i will build next would you be so kind to take part in it[/COLOR]

Production is well under way, it shouldn't be long now. Here's just a small dose of the action of the next episode, I'm thinking of keeping it as something of a sequel to the last 'Hype' video I did.

[video=youtube;dEnyDSoB2yY]https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=dEnyDSoB2yY[/video]

I liked this in particular because it has a bit of a 'Mad Max: Fury Road' vibe going on with it. I'm aiming to get that look in the rest of the episode.

Nooooo! My beautiful, top-heavy machine! Tactical Bananna Peels are its secret weakness.

Outstanding work on the sound effects there, the wreckage sounds amazing.

This happened a few times with me during combat testing, and another vikus could easily flip it over. I was thinking of adding KAS tows and cables to the back in case of a wipeout but I couldn't get it to work. Better ask the Mississippi nicely to flip it over and hope your driver's neck didn't break! :D Edited November 26, 2015 by Mobius

I'm going to suggest holding on to any more submissions until the new forum update arrives, after which a new submissions thread with clarified rules and a fresh start for submissions overall will be posted.This will likely occur between the full launch of the new, updated forums, and December 5th (I've gotta budget some time to post it once the new forums go live).
It will be overseen by HatBat as well as me, as I've been placed in charge of managing submissions to help him reduce his workload and not have to worry about making videos and handling submissions at the same time.

That being said, I would also wait for HatBat to announce if he needs a certain type of craft for the series before posting tons and tons of craft to the thread (this one or the new one after the update). While it's awesome that there's tons of craft being submitted, in the end it can be quite overwhelming and only a handful of craft will wind up being used for each role that needs filling. However, don't let that dissuade you from building craft for the series; just keep in mind that the forthcoming update and new thread/guidelines for submissions will be a bit more strict (to comply with KSP forum rules and to simplify the overall workflow) and will be much more taliored towards meeting the needs of the series in terms of usable craft.

This goes for all submitters, so keep on building, but please follow the guidelines, as it'd going to make things so much more smoothly. Edited November 26, 2015 by ScriptKitt3h
Gave a bit more info on what to expect from the new thread.

[quote name='ScriptKitt3h']Aww yeah! Glad to see things are shaping up to be awesome!

[COLOR="silver"][SIZE=1]- - - Updated - - -[/SIZE][/COLOR]



I'm going to suggest holding on to any more submissions until the new forum update arrives, after which a new submissions thread with clarified rules and a fresh start for submissions overall will be posted.This will likely occur between the full launch of the new, updated forums, and December 5th (I've gotta budget some time to post it once the new forums go live).
It will be overseen by HatBat as well as me, as I've been placed in charge of managing submissions to help him reduce his workload and not have to worry about making videos and handling submissions at the same time.

That being said, I would also wait for HatBat to announce if he needs a certain type of craft for the series before posting tons and tons of craft to the thread (this one or the new one after the update). While it's awesome that there's tons of craft being submitted, in the end it can be quite overwhelming and only a handful of craft will wind up being used for each role that needs filling. However, don't let that dissuade you from building craft for the series; just keep in mind that the forthcoming update and new thread/guidelines for submissions will be a bit more strict (to comply with KSP forum rules and to simplify the overall workflow) and will be much more taliored towards meeting the needs of the series in terms of usable craft.

This goes for all submitters, so keep on building, but please follow the guidelines, as it'd going to make things so much more smoothly.[/QUOTE]

That's not entirely necessary quite yet, as if this thread does get locked, it'll likely be AFTER the forums update on the 27th. I can understand what you're saying though.
Nothing keeps you from showing off your craft you wish to submit, just don't submit it fully (with the file(s)) until after the new thread and guidelines are up and running.

true and this also give me time to rebuild my tank that I want to show off after the new forums come online

I might as well say it now: the golden rule of the new thread will be one post per space agency. No exceptions. You can make multiple space agencies though. This rule will be perfect for Scriptkitt3h and I, though it would limit the community built around the show, so I'd like to keep this thread open as a discussion thread if the moderators permit it.

[quote name='HatBat']I might as well say it now: the golden rule of the new thread will be one post per space agency. No exceptions. You can make multiple space agencies though. This rule will be perfect for Scriptkitt3h and I, though it would limit the community built around the show, so I'd like to keep this thread open as a discussion thread if the moderators permit it.[/QUOTE]


wait im confused are we still aloud to to post multiple craft as long as they go in the same post and if so are we aloud to post updates like when we add a new craft

You can add to and update your post as much as you like, but if you'd like to make a second post (that isn't a separate space agency) then you must use the old thread (this one). So for example, if I made my post a few weeks ago and now I have some new ships to add, then I would edit my original post and post a notification in the old thread. Similarly if I needed to ask a question then I'd use the old thread to do so.

[quote name='HatBat']You can add to and update your post as much as you like, but if you'd like to make a second post (that isn't a separate space agency) then you must use the old thread (this one). So for example, if I made my post a few weeks ago and now I have some new ships to add, then I would edit my original post and post a notification in the old thread. Similarly if I needed to ask a question then I'd use the old thread to do so.[/QUOTE]

so in my case i would just post the link to my forum page wherre all my craft and just specify whats knew

Yeah, but you'd be linking to your post on the submissions thread. Linking to your own thread would be against the rules and likely get ignored because we'd doubt that many ships on it would fit the requirements for submissions/we wouldn't have the time to find the ones that did meet requirements.
